title: Full-Stack Dart Quiz
description: Test your understanding of full-stack Dart benefits and when to use Dart backends.

questions.text: What is the PRIMARY advantage of using Dart for both frontend and backend?
options: Dart runs faster than all other languages
You can share code (like models) between Flutter and the server
Other backend languages don't support REST APIs
questions.explanation: The main advantage is code sharing. When you use Dart on both ends, you can write model classes once and use them everywhere. This reduces duplication and bugs from mismatched definitions.

questions.text: Which framework is described as 'Next.js for Dart' with file-based routing?
questions.explanation: Dart Frog uses file-based routing (create a file, get a route) similar to Next.js. It's lightweight and perfect for learning and prototypes.

questions.text: When might you choose a NON-Dart backend?
options: When your existing team uses Python and has ML expertise
questions.explanation: If your team already has expertise in another language (like Python for ML), forcing Dart might cause friction. Technology choices should consider team skills and ecosystem needs.

questions.text: What does Shelf provide in the Dart ecosystem?
options: A full ORM and authentication system
questions.explanation: Shelf is the low-level HTTP server library for Dart. It's the foundation that frameworks like Dart Frog build upon. It gives you complete control but requires more manual work.
